full_text: L. C. J. S. (Dartford): (1) Moscow Comintern (1,450 m.). Special bulletins broadcast for the benefit of men’s clubs and rest houses. They are read slowly in order to allow transcription to be made of the news; (2) first harmonic of aircraft transmission (900 m.). (3) Do you mean 12.30 a.m. or p.m.? If p.m., possibly Göteborg, relaying weather report and news bulletin from Stockholm; (4) Rome (selections from Italian operettas). (5) Dublin. From 9—10.30 p.m. The Atlantic Beach Dance Band. See programme in World Radio.

observation_text: A performance of Gounod’s Faust was not advertised in any European programme, but from reports received from listeners we are inclined to believe that it was given by Moscow-Comintern (Russia); probably a concert version from the Trades Union Hall, Moscow, from which transmissions are frequently relayed.
